attributes.action: UK Government - rethink the E-Cig regulations starting May 2017.
attributes.additional_details:
Ahead are some of the new laws. Causing more plastic waste and less people kicking their smoking habits, causing a mass amount of strain on the NHS from cigarette inflicted health issues.

• Refill containers cannot exceed 10ml
• maximum nicotine strength of 20mg
• maximum tank capacity of 2ml

Please read these articles:
https://cigelectric.co.uk/tpd-vaping-laws-uk-2017-regulations/

http://www.nhs.uk/news/2015/08August/Pages/E-cigarettes-95-per-cent-less-harmful-than-smoking-says-report.aspx
attributes.background: It is proven that E-cigarettes are 95% healthier than tobacco cigarettes, they help smokers to cut down on nicotine and eventually stop with all tobacco products. These new laws make E-Cigs more expensive, less environmentally friendly and a huge reduction of quality products offered.

rejection.details: The issue you raise is not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament. The Tobacco Products Directive (TPD) is an EU Directive. You could start a new petition asking for the UK Government to work with other EU member states to change the TPD, or to change the law on e-cigarettes after the UK leaves the EU.
